comments:
To reproduce:
=============
1. create a java project in your workspace
2. open the New web service client wizard
3. In the service definition field, put in a wsdl url, such as
   http://www.xmethods.net/sd/2001/TemperatureService.wsdl
4. Select the project created in step 1 as the target project
5. Move the slider all the way up to "Test"
6. Click Finish.

You'll get the following exception in a pop-up dialog box:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

Kathy, please investigate. In general, we don't handle JSP generation in the context of J2SE clients in Java projects, so this may not be critical to WTP 1.5.1, even though the error is unpleasant. Please determine if this is a regression from 1.5. Thanks - CB.
*** Bug 158187 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=50743)
patch for jst.ws.consumption.ui

I have a simple patch for this problem.  There is a check in the WebServiceClientTestArrivalCommand to see if the client project is a web project.  This check should have been placed a couple of lines earlier so that the code does not try to get the WebContent folder location from a non-web project.
Thanks for the patch Andrew. Targetted to 1.5.2.
And moved to assigned state for review/commit of the patch once the 1.5.2 stream opens up for business.
Targetted to 1.5.2. This is a regression.

PMC, would you please approve this for WTP 1.5.2.

This is a regression in which the Web service client wizard dies due to an NPE when it is asked to generate a Java Web service client into a plain Java project that already exists in the workspace. The problem does not occur if the target Java project does not actually exist yet in the workspace, or if the target project is a Web project, though neither of these constitute a reasonable workaround.

The fix is simple. It checks to see if the given project is a Web project before trying to retrieve its WebContent folder instead of after.

Thanks - CB.
Released to WTP 1.5.2 as v200610042148.  Will release to HEAD shortly.
Also released to HEAD as v200610050239.
